item.title: Setting Up a Static Website with GitHub Pages and Jekyll
item.author: Author
item.description: The first problem I encountered when I decided to start a blog was deciding which hosting platform I should use. There are many great options out there, and I wanted to find a platform that won’t break the bank but is still easy to use and customize. After doing a lot of research and considering various hosting platforms (i.e. WordPress, GoDaddy, Squarespace, Bluehost, AWS, Firebase, etc.), I decided on GitHub Pages and Jekyll for the following reasons:
